entities.name: uncle vernon
entities.description: Uncle Vernon is introduced as a character who can sense that Harry is a man whom it would be difficult to bully. He is described as being threatened by Dumbledore's words and tone.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is introduced as a wise and authoritative figure who can see through Uncle Vernon's attempts to intimidate Harry. He uses his half-moon glasses to look at Harry with a satisfied expression.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is introduced as the main character whom Dumbledore and Uncle Vernon are interacting with. He is described as being looked at by Dumbledore with a satisfied expression.

entities.name: petunia
entities.description: Petunia is introduced as Harry's aunt who enters the kitchen wearing rubber gloves and a housecoat over her nightdress. She is described as being halfway through her usual pre-bedtime wipe-down of all the kitchen surfaces.

relationships.description: Uncle Vernon and Dumbledore have a disagreement as Uncle Vernon is threatened by Dumbledore's words and tone, while Dumbledore seems to be satisfied with the situation.
Uncle Vernon tries to bully Harry but fails as Dumbledore intervenes and praises Harry.
Dumbledore introduces Petunia to Uncle Vernon, saying 'Ah, and this must be Petunia'.
